title: Julius Hauser -- Documentation of FBI Investigations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all reports of investigations of the loyalty to the United States of my late father, Julius Hauser (1914-2006).

Julius Hauser was employed by the Food and Drug Administration, first in Chicago and, after 1949, in Washington, DC, between the late 1930s and the mid-1960s.

On at least three occasions, beginning in the early 1940s and again in the late 1940s and mid-1950s, he was accused of being a communist subversive and disloyal to the United States. On each such occasion, he was found innocent of those accusations and loyal to the United States of America.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert M. Hauser
604 South Washington Square, Apt 2709
Philadelphia PA 19106
Email: rmhauser@gmail.com
Phone: 608-2094328

title: Meta-FOIA Request AAAJ-Atlanta, et al. v. ICE Requests

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request to ICE FOIA for processing notes, taskers, suspension trackers, FOIA tasking worksheets, and any other records created over the course of the agency's response to the records requests designated by the agency as:  
(1) 2018-ICFO-61726;  
(2) 2022-ICFO-26971 (including number 2022-ICAP-01049); 
(3) 2023-ICFO-02405; and 
(4) 2024-ICFO-38604 (including appeal number 2025-ICAP-00012).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Joey Scott
